medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred for pediatric endocrine evaluation due to severe postnatal growth retardation. He was born small for gestational age for birth weight but appropriate for birth length. At initial presentation, he was 114.6 cm tall at age 9.6 years, with a gradual decline noted in growth velocity despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder, treated with methylphenidate.
medical_history.family_history: Short stature noted on the maternal side of the family, including the mother and a sibling who also carry a heterozygous mutation.
